vendor: Sightview EHR Holdings, LLC (MD Office, LLC and others)

access.notes: Page is a HubSpot-hosted compliance hub behind Cloudflare. EHI data dictionary PDFs are inside a 'MORE INFO +' expandable card/modal labeled 'EHI Export Data Dictionary' in the Certifications section. Content is in the DOM and discoverable via grep, but requires clicking to see visually.

export_format.description: Export produces two ZIP files: ehi_structured_file.zip (CSV files organized into folders: Administration, Clinical, Clinical Notes, Communications, Diagnostic Imaging, Encounters, Ophthalmic Data) and ehi_unstructured_file.zip (documents and images). Each export job gets a unique Job ID as the folder name.

documentation.notes: Each product has its own PDF data dictionary (Version 2.0, effective July/August 2024). Documentation provides CSV file names, column names, and brief column descriptions/comments for each data element. Data types (string, integer, date, etc.) are NOT explicitly specified. MDoffice has fewer CSVs (50 vs 68) — it lacks the Communications section (patient/provider messages) and some clinical subsections present in the other products.

clinical.evidence: Extensive clinical data: Allergies, Family Health History, Functional Assessment, Goals, Health Concerns, Immunizations, Implantable Devices, Medications, Nutrition/Diet, Problems, Procedures, Smoking Status, Substance Use, Vitals. Also Progress Notes, Provider Notes, Assessment & Plan, Lab Orders/Results, Radiology Orders, Specimen data.

secure_messages.evidence: Communications folder with Patient_to_Provider_Messages.csv, Provider_to_Patient_Messages.csv, Provider_to_Provider_Messages.csv (fields: PATIENT_ID, fname, lname, msg_subject, msg_data, physician, msg_date_time). Present in iMedicWare, ManagementPlus, Medflow, My Vision Express. NOT present in MDoffice.

billing_financial.evidence: No dedicated billing/charge/claim/payment tables. Encounter.CSV contains CPT codes (Ccda_cpt_code, cpt_Code) and Prior_Authorizations.csv contains auth_cpt_code and AuthAmount, but there are no charge amounts, claim submissions, payment records, or financial transaction tables.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Insurance_Data.csv with fields: case_name, type (Primary/Secondary), fname, lname, policy_number, group_number, plan_name, effective_date, expiration_date. Prior_Authorizations.csv with auth_required, auth_name, AuthAmount, auth_cpt_code, auth_date, auth_comment, auth_prov.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: No appointment or scheduling tables. Encounter.CSV documents clinical encounters (date of service, CPT codes) but not scheduling/appointment booking data.

documents_images.evidence: Export includes a separate ehi_unstructured_file.zip containing documents and images. Extensive Diagnostic Imaging section with CSVs for: Ascan, Bscan, Cell Count, Custom Test, External Anterior, Fundus, GDX, HRT, ICG, IOL-Master, IVFA, Laboratories, OCT, OCT-RNFL, Pachy, Topography, VF, VF-GL (ophthalmic imaging data).

audit_trails.evidence: No audit trail, access log, or tracking tables found in any of the data dictionaries.

ophthalmic_specialty.evidence: Extensive ophthalmology/optometry-specific data: AR (autorefractor), BAT, Chart_CVF, Chart_Dilation, Chart_EOM, Chart_IOP, Color_Vision_Test, Contact_Lens, Cycloplegic_Retino, Cycloplegic_AR, Exam_External, Glasses_Prescription, PAM, Refraction, Retinoscopy, Stereopsis, Vision_Distance_Near_Acuity. These are eye care EHR systems (formerly Eye Care Leaders).

downloaded_files.notes: Older V1.1 version (Dec 2023). Superseded by V2.0 MDoffice_EHI_Export_Data_Dictionary.pdf.

issues: No billing/financial data tables (charges, claims, payments) in any product's export — significant gap for ophthalmology practices
MDoffice lacks the Communications section (patient/provider messages) that the other 4 products include
Data types not specified in documentation — only column names and brief descriptions provided
Regulatory Compliance Platform and myCare Portal do not have their own EHI export — they rely on the underlying EHR product
summary: Sightview EHR Holdings operates 5 ophthalmology/optometry EHR products (MDoffice, ManagementPlus, Medflow, My Vision Express, iMedicWare) plus a compliance platform and patient portal. Each EHR product has a dedicated PDF data dictionary (Version 2.0, ~50-68 pages) documenting a CSV-based export packaged as ZIP files (structured + unstructured). The export covers clinical data, demographics, insurance, diagnostic imaging (extensive ophthalmic tests), and secure messages (except MDoffice), but notably omits billing/financial data, appointment scheduling, and audit trails. Documentation provides field-level column names with descriptions but no explicit data types.
